slides.title: India - Basic Facts
slides.content:
**Location:**
- Continent: Asia (South Asia)
- Coordinates: Between 8°4'N to 37°6'N latitude
- Total Area: 32,87,263 sq km (7th largest in world)
- Land Boundaries: 15,200 km
- Coastline: 7,516.6 km

**Neighboring Countries:**
- **North:** China, Nepal, Bhutan
- **South:** Sri Lanka, Maldives (across sea)
- **East:** Bangladesh, Myanmar
- **West:** Pakistan
- **Northwest:** Afghanistan

**States and Union Territories:**
- Total States: 28
- Union Territories: 8
- National Capital: New Delhi

**Largest & Smallest:**
- Largest State (Area): Rajasthan
- Smallest State (Area): Goa
- Largest State (Population): Uttar Pradesh
- Smallest State (Population): Sikkim

slides.title: Mountains and Plateaus
slides.content:
**Himalayan Mountains:**
- Highest mountain range in the world
- Extends from Jammu & Kashmir to Arunachal Pradesh
- **Highest Peak:** Mount Everest (8,849 m) - in Nepal
- **Highest Peak in India:** Kanchenjunga (8,586 m) - Sikkim
- **Three Ranges:**
  - Himadri (Greater Himalayas)
  - Himachal (Lesser Himalayas)
  - Shiwaliks (Outer Himalayas)

**Other Mountain Ranges:**
- **Western Ghats:** Along western coast
- **Eastern Ghats:** Along eastern coast
- **Aravalli Range:** Oldest mountains in India (Rajasthan)
- **Vindhya Range:** Central India
- **Satpura Range:** Central India

**Plateaus:**
- **Deccan Plateau:** Large plateau in South India
- **Chota Nagpur Plateau:** Jharkhand (rich in minerals)
- **Malwa Plateau:** Madhya Pradesh

**Important Passes:**
- **Khyber Pass:** Pakistan border
- **Nathu La:** Sikkim-China border
- **Rohtang Pass:** Himachal Pradesh

slides.title: Rivers of India
slides.content:
**Major Rivers:**

**1. Ganga (2,525 km):**
- Longest river in India
- Origin: Gangotri Glacier (Uttarakhand)
- Ends: Bay of Bengal
- Holy river for Hindus
- Main tributaries: Yamuna, Ghaghara, Gandak, Kosi

**2. Brahmaputra:**
- Origin: Tibet (as Tsangpo)
- Flows through: Tibet, India (Assam), Bangladesh
- Known as Red River (due to soil)

**3. Yamuna:**
- Origin: Yamunotri Glacier
- Tributary of Ganga
- Flows through: Delhi, Agra

**4. Godavari:**
- Longest river in South India (1,465 km)
- Known as 'Dakshin Ganga'
- Origin: Maharashtra
- Ends: Bay of Bengal

**5. Krishna:**
- Origin: Maharashtra
- Flows through: Karnataka, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh
- Ends: Bay of Bengal

**6. Narmada:**
- Flows westward
- Ends: Arabian Sea
- Famous for: Marble rocks

**7. Indus:**
- Origin: Tibet (Lake Mansarovar)
- Now mainly in Pakistan
- Ancient civilization: Indus Valley

slides.title: Important Cities and Natural Resources
slides.content:
**Important Cities:**

**Metros:**
- Delhi: National Capital
- Mumbai: Financial capital, largest city
- Kolkata: Cultural capital
- Chennai: Detroit of India (automobiles)
- Bengaluru: IT capital, Silicon Valley of India
- Hyderabad: Cyberabad, Pearl City

**Other Important Cities:**
- Ahmedabad: Textile city
- Jaipur: Pink City
- Varanasi: Oldest living city, holy city
- Amritsar: Golden Temple
- Pune: Oxford of East
- Surat: Diamond city

**Natural Resources:**

**Minerals:**
- **Coal:** Jharkhand, Odisha, Chhattisgarh
- **Iron Ore:** Odisha, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh
- **Petroleum:** Mumbai High, Assam, Gujarat
- **Gold:** Karnataka (Kolar)
- **Mica:** Jharkhand, Andhra Pradesh

**Crops:**
- **Rice:** West Bengal, Uttar Pradesh, Andhra Pradesh
- **Wheat:** Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Haryana
- **Cotton:** Gujarat, Maharashtra, Haryana
- **Tea:** Assam, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu
- **Coffee:** Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu
- **Sugarcane:** Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra

**Forests:**
- About 23% of India's land is forest
- Major forests in: Madhya Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Chhattisgarh
